goals: Test current max on back squat (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on bench press (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on push press (baseline: 165x3)
Establish new baseline maxes for future programming
Improve shoulder mobility through consistent warm-up protocols
Maintain conditioning capacity with finishers and one longer session weekly
programContext.purpose: Conservative progression block designed to establish new baseline maxes on deadlift, squat, bench press, and push press while respecting limited recovery capacity (6-hour sleep, high work stress). Focuses on systematic strength development with integrated mobility work and conditioning.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Trahens
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
5x5 @ 205lbs (75% of estimated max ~275lbs)

Focus: Keep chest up throughout the pull. Feel your weight in mid-foot. Drive through the floor with your legs before pulling with your back.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If form breaks or hips shoot up early, reduce to 195lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Film your third set - I want to see hip timing and chest position. Your hips have been rising early in previous sessions. Focus on feeling tension in your hamstrings before you pull. If bar speed slows significantly on set 4 or 5, stop there.

workoutTemplates.name: Catena Accessorius
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
12 Romanian Deadlifts @ 135lbs
10 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 40lb DBs
15 Bent Over Rows @ 135lbs

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Control the eccentric on RDLs. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings. Keep torso upright on split squats.

workoutTemplates.name: Infernus Velocitas
workoutTemplates.description:
10 minute AMRAP:
12 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
10 Box Step-Ups (20", alternating legs)
8 Burpees

Pace: Keep it steady. Aim for 4-5 rounds. Don't redline - this is about consistent work capacity.

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x5 @ 195lbs (75% of estimated max ~260lbs)

Focus: Bar path straight up and down. Engage your lats. Drive through your feet. Touch chest every rep.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If you can't touch chest with control, reduce to 185lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Focus on leg drive and maintaining your arch. If bar speed slows significantly, stop the set. We're building volume tolerance, not grinding reps. Film a set if you want feedback on bar path.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Auxilium
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Close-Grip Bench Press @ 155lbs
12 Dumbbell Rows (each arm) @ 60lbs
15 Dips (scale to bench dips if needed)

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Full range of motion on all movements. Control the negative.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 12:
Minute 1: 15 Calories Assault Bike
Minute 2: 20 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Minute 3: 15 Push-Ups
Minute 4: Rest

Repeat 3x through.

Pace: Should finish each minute with 15-20 seconds rest. Scale reps if needed to maintain that buffer.

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
Deficit Deadlift (2" deficit)
4x6 @ 185lbs (65% of estimated max)

Focus: Increased range of motion. Keep back flat. Feel the extra stretch in your hamstrings at the bottom.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If you can't maintain neutral spine, reduce deficit to 1" or use regular deadlift at same weight.
workoutTemplates.notes: This variation builds strength off the floor - your weak point. The deficit increases range of motion and demands more from your hamstrings and low back. If your back rounds at all, stop immediately and reduce the deficit or weight.

workoutTemplates.name: Vigor Tractus
workoutTemplates.description:
5 Rounds:
8 Pull-Ups (strict, scale to banded if needed)
12 Barbell Rows @ 135lbs
15 Face Pulls @ light resistance

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Quality pulling. Squeeze your shoulder blades together. Control the tempo.

workoutTemplates.name: Ferrum Rapidus
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds For Time:
400m Row
20 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
15 Burpees

Time Cap: 15 minutes

Pace: Push the row, control the swings, survive the burpees. Aim to finish under 12 minutes.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Potentia
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x5 @ 125lbs (75% of estimated max ~165lbs)

Focus: Explosive leg drive. Dip straight down, drive straight up. Don't press too early. Respect your shoulder ROM - stop if you feel pinching.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If shoulder feels restricted, reduce to 115lbs and focus on timing.
workoutTemplates.notes: Key coaching point: the power comes from your legs, not your shoulders. Dip depth should be 4-6 inches. If you feel shoulder pinching or can't get the bar overhead comfortably, stop immediately. Film a set so I can see your dip timing and bar path.

workoutTemplates.name: Magnus Scapula
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Dumbbell Shoulder Press @ 40lbs (each hand)
12 Lateral Raises @ 20lbs
15 Dumbbell Shrugs @ 60lbs
20 Band Pull-Aparts

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Control and quality. Build shoulder stability and upper back strength.

workoutTemplates.name: Ventus Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
8 minute AMRAP:
10 Dumbbell Thrusters @ 35lbs (each hand)
12 Calories Assault Bike
14 Sit-Ups

Pace: Steady effort. Aim for 3-4 rounds. Keep breathing controlled.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Crura
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x5 @ 185lbs (75% of estimated max ~245lbs)

Focus: Hit depth consistently every rep. Chest stays up. Drive through your heels. Feel your glutes engage at the bottom.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If you can't hit depth with good form, reduce to 175lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Your squat needs work - we both know it. Film your third set. I want to see depth consistency and torso angle. If your chest collapses forward, that's a technique issue we need to address. Focus on one cue today: keeping your chest up throughout the entire rep.

workoutTemplates.name: Potentia Unilateral
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 50lb DBs
12 Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts (each leg) @ 40lb DB
15 Goblet Squats @ 60lb DB
20 Walking Lunges (total steps) @ bodyweight

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Balance and control. These are your strengths - leverage them.

workoutTemplates.name: Chaos Velocitas
workoutTemplates.description:
12 minute AMRAP:
15 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
12 Box Step-Ups (20")
10 Push-Ups
8 Calories Row

Pace: Consistent rounds. Aim for 4-5 rounds. Don't blow up early.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Longus
workoutTemplates.description:
For Time (30 minute cap):
50 Calories Row
40 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
30 Box Step-Ups (20")
20 Burpees
30 Box Step-Ups
40 Kettlebell Swings
50 Calories Row

Pace: This is a grind. Break up movements strategically. Aim to finish under 25 minutes. Keep intensity at RPE 6-7 throughout - conversational pace.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is your longer conditioning day. The goal is aerobic capacity building, not max effort. Keep your heart rate in Zone 2-3. If you're gasping for air, you're going too hard. Break movements into manageable sets.

workoutTemplates.name: Recuperatio Mobilis
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery:
10 minutes total

- 3 minutes foam rolling (focus: upper back, lats, glutes, hamstrings)
- 3 minutes shoulder mobility: arm circles, band pull-aparts, wall slides
- 2 minutes hip mobility: 90/90 stretches, pigeon pose
- 2 minutes light stretching: hamstrings, hip flexors, chest

This is your rest day. Do this work. Your body needs it.

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Trahens
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
5x5 @ 210lbs (77% of estimated max - 5lb increase from week 1)

Focus: Same cues as last week. Chest up, weight in mid-foot, hips and chest rise together.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If form breaks, reduce to 205lbs. We're progressing, not regressing.
workoutTemplates.notes: Progressive overload - 5lbs up from last week. If you filmed your deadlifts last week and made corrections, this should feel smoother. If form is still breaking down, we need to address technique before adding more weight.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
15 Romanian Deadlifts @ 135lbs
12 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 40lb DBs
12 Barbell Rows @ 145lbs
15 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Volume increase from last week. Maintain quality movement.

workoutTemplates.name: Ignis Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 15:
Minute 1: 12 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Minute 2: 12 Box Step-Ups (20")
Minute 3: 10 Burpees

Repeat 5x through.

Pace: Should have 15-20 seconds rest each minute. Scale reps if needed.

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Magnus
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x5 @ 200lbs (77% of estimated max - 5lb increase)

Focus: Bar path, leg drive, lat engagement. Touch chest every rep with control.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If bar speed slows significantly or you can't touch chest, reduce to 195lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is your strong lift. 5lbs up from last week should feel manageable. If it doesn't, something's off with recovery. Focus on maintaining bar speed across all sets.

workoutTemplates.name: Vigor Pectoralis
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
12 Incline Dumbbell Press @ 50lbs (each hand)
10 Dips (scale to bench dips if needed)
15 Dumbbell Rows (each arm) @ 60lbs
12 Dumbbell Flyes @ 30lbs

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Full ROM, control the eccentric.

workoutTemplates.name: Ferrum Velocitas
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds For Time:
12 Calories Assault Bike
10 Dumbbell Push Press @ 35lbs (each hand)
8 Pull-Ups

Time Cap: 12 minutes

Pace: Push the bike, control the push press, survive the pull-ups. Aim under 10 minutes.

workoutTemplates.name: Catena Defectus
workoutTemplates.description:
Deficit Deadlift (2" deficit)
4x6 @ 190lbs (5lb increase from last week)

Focus: Extra ROM, flat back, hamstring engagement.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If back rounds, reduce deficit or drop to 185lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Building strength off the floor - your weak point. 5lbs up from last week. This should feel challenging but doable. If your back rounds at all, stop immediately.

workoutTemplates.name: Magnus Tractus
workoutTemplates.description:
5 Rounds:
10 Pull-Ups (strict)
12 Barbell Rows @ 145lbs
15 Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows @ 65lbs (each arm)
12 Face Pulls

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Quality pulling volume. Squeeze shoulder blades together.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Medius
workoutTemplates.description:
21-15-9 For Time:
Calories Row
Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Burpees

Time Cap: 12 minutes

Pace: This is a sprint. Go hard. Aim to finish under 10 minutes.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Magnus
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x5 @ 130lbs (5lb increase from last week)

Focus: Explosive leg drive, timing, bar path. Respect shoulder ROM.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If shoulder feels restricted or timing is off, stay at 125lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: 5lbs up. This should still feel manageable if your leg drive is solid. If you're pressing too early or your shoulder feels pinched, reduce weight and focus on timing.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Scapula
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
12 Dumbbell Shoulder Press @ 45lbs (each hand)
15 Lateral Raises @ 20lbs
12 Front Raises @ 25lbs
15 Dumbbell Shrugs @ 65lbs
20 Band Pull-Aparts

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Shoulder stability and upper back strength.

workoutTemplates.name: Chaos Rapidus
workoutTemplates.description:
10 minute AMRAP:
8 Dumbbell Thrusters @ 40lbs (each hand)
10 Calories Assault Bike
12 Sit-Ups

Pace: Steady. Aim for 4-5 rounds. Control your breathing.

workoutTemplates.name: Crura Potentia
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x5 @ 190lbs (5lb increase from last week)

Focus: Depth, chest up, drive through heels. Feel glutes at bottom.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Scale: If depth suffers, reduce to 185lbs. Quality over ego.
workoutTemplates.notes: Your squat is lagging. 5lbs up from last week. Film your third set again. I want to see if you're maintaining depth and torso position as the weight increases. If not, we're addressing technique before progressing further.

workoutTemplates.name: Vigor Unilateral
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
12 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 50lb DBs
10 Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts (each leg) @ 45lb DB
12 Goblet Squats @ 65lb DB
20 Walking Lunges @ bodyweight
15 Leg Curls (if available, or hamstring slides)

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus: Unilateral strength - your advantage. Use it.

workoutTemplates.name: Infernus Medius
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 15:
Minute 1: 15 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Minute 2: 12 Box Step-Ups (20")
Minute 3: 12 Push-Ups

Repeat 5x through.

Pace: 15-20 seconds rest each minute. Scale if needed.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Endurance
workoutTemplates.description:
For Time (30 minute cap):
60 Calories Row
50 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
40 Box Step-Ups (20")
30 Burpees
40 Box Step-Ups
50 Kettlebell Swings
60 Calories Row

Pace: Aerobic capacity building. RPE 6-7. Break movements strategically. Aim under 26 minutes.
workoutTemplates.notes: Longer conditioning day. Volume increased from last week. Keep intensity moderate - this builds your aerobic base without compromising strength recovery. If you're gasping, slow down.

workoutTemplates.name: Recuperatio Completa
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery:
15 minutes total

- 5 minutes foam rolling (upper back, lats, glutes, hamstrings, quads)
- 4 minutes shoulder mobility: arm circles, band work, wall slides
- 3 minutes hip mobility: 90/90 stretches, pigeon pose, hip flexor stretches
- 3 minutes light stretching: hamstrings, calves, chest, triceps

Complete rest day. Do this mobility work. You need it after 2 weeks of volume.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Squat
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x4 @ 215lbs (78% of working max)

Focus: Hit depth consistently every rep. Keep chest up throughout the descent. Drive through mid-foot, not toes. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

This is higher intensity than last week - expect RPE 8 on final sets. Film your third set so I can check depth consistency.

Scale: If form breaks or depth gets shallow, reduce to 205lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: We're increasing intensity to 78% this week. Watch for hip rise - keep chest and hips moving together. Film set 3 and send it to me. If you feel any sharp pain or form breakdown, stop immediately and reduce weight 10lbs. This should feel challenging but controlled - RPE 8 on last set.

workoutTemplates.name: Accessorius Inferior
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
12 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 35lb DBs
15 Romanian Deadlifts @ 135lbs
20 Weighted Step-Ups (24" box) @ 25lb DBs

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Focus on controlled tempo - 3 seconds down, 1 second up. These build your squat and deadlift foundation. Keep tension throughout each movement.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
12 Minute AMRAP:
12 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
10 Box Step-Ups (24", alternating)
8 Burpees

Pace yourself - aim for consistent rounds. Target 4-5 rounds total. Keep breathing controlled, don't redline early.

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x4 @ 225lbs (82% of working max)

Focus: Tight setup - retract scapula, arch maintained, feet driven into floor. Bar path straight over mid-chest. Controlled descent, explosive press. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

This is your strength - leverage it. Should feel like RPE 7-8. Touch chest every rep, no bouncing.

Scale: If bar speed slows significantly, reduce to 215lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Your bench is strong - time to push it harder. Focus on leg drive and maintaining your arch throughout. Bar should touch the same spot on your chest every rep. If you're unsure about form, film a set. This weight should move with speed - if it grinds, you're too heavy.

workoutTemplates.name: Accessorius Superior
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Close-Grip Bench Press @ 165lbs
12 Bent-Over Barbell Rows @ 135lbs
15 Dumbbell Overhead Press @ 30lb DBs (respect shoulder ROM)
20 Tricep Dips

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Close-grip builds lockout strength. Rows balance pressing volume. Keep overhead press within comfortable range - no forcing ROM.
workoutTemplates.notes: On overhead press, only go as high as your shoulder mobility allows comfortably. Don't force full ROM - we're working around your restriction, not through it.

workoutTemplates.name: Velocitas Ferrum
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 15:
Minute 1: 15 Calorie Assault Bike
Minute 2: 12 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Minute 3: 10 Push-Ups

Repeat 5 times through. Work should take 30-40 seconds each minute, leaving 20-30 seconds rest. Stay consistent - don't blow out early.

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Trahens
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
6x3 @ 255lbs (85% of working max)

Focus: Perfect setup every rep. Weight mid-foot, lats engaged, chest up. Feel tension in hamstrings before you pull. Hips and chest rise together - no hip shoot.

Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. This is your weak point - we're fixing it with volume and intensity.

Film set 3 or 4. I need to see your pull mechanics.

Scale: If hips rise early or back rounds, drop to 245lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is 85% - highest intensity yet. Your deadlift needs work, so I'm watching closely. Film a heavy set. Focus on setup: weight mid-foot, pull slack out of bar, feel hamstring tension, then pull. Hips and chest move together. If your hips shoot up first, you're losing power and risking injury. Stop and reduce weight if form breaks.

workoutTemplates.name: Catena Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
10 Deficit Deadlifts (stand on 2" plates) @ 185lbs
12 Glute-Ham Raises or Nordic Curls
15 Barbell Hip Thrusts @ 185lbs
20 Banded Pull-Throughs

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Deficit deadlifts build starting strength. Control the eccentric. These movements directly address your deadlift weakness.
workoutTemplates.notes: Deficit deadlifts are key for your starting strength off the floor. Keep same form as regular deadlifts - just starting from a deeper position. If you don't have GHD, do Nordic curls with partner assist or slow eccentric only.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Rapidus
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds For Time:
400m Row
21 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
15 Box Jumps (24")

Target: 12-15 minutes. Pace the row at 80% effort, attack the swings and box jumps. This builds work capacity without compromising tomorrow's recovery.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Potentia
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x3 @ 155lbs (87% of working max)

Focus: Strong dip - knees forward, torso vertical. Explosive drive through heels. Minimal press overhead - let the legs do the work. Respect shoulder ROM - don't force overhead position.

Rest 3 minutes between sets. Should feel like RPE 8.

Scale: If shoulder discomfort or bar path is off, reduce to 145lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Push press lets you use leg drive to reduce shoulder ROM demands. Focus on explosive hip extension - that's where the power comes from. Dip straight down (knees forward, not back), then drive hard through your heels. The bar should fly up from leg power, not shoulder press. Stop if you feel any shoulder pain.

workoutTemplates.name: Accessorius Completus
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
10 Dumbbell Bench Press @ 60lb DBs
12 Weighted Pull-Ups (add 25lbs if possible, or bodyweight)
15 Dumbbell Rows (each arm) @ 50lb DB
20 Face Pulls with band

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Balance pressing with pulling. Face pulls address upper back mobility - pull band to face level, squeeze shoulder blades.

workoutTemplates.name: Infernus Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
10 Minute AMRAP:
10 Dumbbell Thrusters (35lb DBs)
15 Calorie Row
20 Air Squats

Target 4 rounds. Keep thrusters unbroken if possible. This should burn - embrace it. Consistent pacing beats sprinting then dying.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Combinatio
workoutTemplates.description:
Front Squat
4x5 @ 165lbs (lighter load, quad focus)

Focus: Elbows high, chest up, core tight. Front squats build your squat foundation and address weak points. Bar sits on front delts - keep elbows up throughout.

Rest 2.5 minutes between sets.

Then:

Pause Back Squat
3x3 @ 185lbs (2-second pause at bottom)

Focus: Control in the hole. Pause eliminates bounce, builds bottom strength. Rest 3 minutes between sets.
workoutTemplates.notes: Front squats force upright posture and hit quads hard. Keep elbows high - if they drop, the bar rolls forward. Pause squats eliminate momentum and build strength in your weakest position. Count '1-Mississippi, 2-Mississippi' in the bottom, then drive up. These variations directly address your squat weakness.

workoutTemplates.name: Accessorius Lunges
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
20 Walking Lunges (10 each leg) @ 45lb DBs
15 Goblet Squats @ 53lb KB
12 Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts (each leg) @ 30lb DB

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Lunges are your strength - use them. Focus on balance and control on single-leg RDLs.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Corpus
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 16:
Minute 1: 20 Calorie Assault Bike
Minute 2: 15 Burpees
Minute 3: 12 Dumbbell Snatches (alternating, 50lb DB)
Minute 4: Rest

Repeat 4 times through. Work minutes should take 35-45 seconds. Push the bike and burpees, control the snatches.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Enduro
workoutTemplates.description:
30 Minute Mixed Modality Endurance:

Every 6 minutes, rotate:
Minutes 0-6: Row (steady pace, ~2:10/500m)
Minutes 6-12: Assault Bike (moderate effort, conversational)
Minutes 12-18: Run or Ski Erg (steady, sustainable)
Minutes 18-24: Row
Minutes 24-30: Assault Bike

Goal: Build aerobic base. Stay at RPE 6-7 throughout. This should feel like work but you should be able to hold a conversation. Not a sprint - sustainable effort for 30 minutes.

Track total calories or distance covered on each modality.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is your longer conditioning day. Keep intensity at RPE 6-7 - you should be breathing harder than normal but able to talk in full sentences. This builds your aerobic engine without compromising strength recovery. Don't go hard - go steady. Track your output so we can measure progress.

workoutTemplates.name: Recuperatio Mobilis
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery & Mobility:

10 minutes:
- Shoulder mobility: arm circles, band pull-aparts, wall slides
- Thoracic spine: foam roll upper back, cat-cow stretches
- Hip mobility: 90/90 stretches, pigeon pose, hip circles

10 minutes light movement:
- Easy bike or walk
- Bodyweight squats, lunges (no load)

This is rest day. Focus on recovery. Stretch, move gently, prepare for next week's training. Your body needs this.

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Trahens Primus
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift Taper Work

3x2 @ 245lbs (85% of estimated max ~285lbs)

This is taper week - we're reducing volume significantly to allow full recovery before max testing. Focus on crisp, fast bar speed and perfect form. Each rep should feel explosive off the floor.

Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. Film your sets - I want to see bar speed and form quality.

Scale: If bar speed is slow or form breaks, stop immediately. You should feel fresh and powerful.
workoutTemplates.notes: Film all sets. Bar speed should be fast and crisp - if it slows down, you're too heavy. Focus on feeling your lats engage before you pull. Keep your chest up throughout the entire pull. This is about quality, not grinding reps. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets to ensure full recovery.

workoutTemplates.name: Catena Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
Posterior Chain Accessory

3 Rounds:
10 Romanian Deadlifts @ 135lbs
12 Single-Leg RDLs each leg @ 35lb DB
15 Glute Bridges (bodyweight, 2-second squeeze at top)

Keep it light and controlled. Focus on feeling the hamstrings and glutes working. Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

This is maintenance volume - we're not trying to destroy you during taper week.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep loads light - this is about blood flow and movement quality, not intensity. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings on RDLs. Squeeze glutes hard at the top of bridges.

workoutTemplates.name: Velocitas Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
8 Minute AMRAP:
12 KB Swings @ 53lbs
10 Box Step-Ups @ 20 inches (alternating legs)
8 Burpees

Keep the pace steady and controlled. This should feel like RPE 6-7, conversational throughout. We're maintaining conditioning capacity without accumulating fatigue.

Aim for 3-4 rounds. Focus on consistent movement, not max effort.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is low-intensity conditioning to maintain capacity. Keep breathing controlled. If you're gasping for air, you're going too hard.

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Magnus
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press Taper Work

3x2 @ 225lbs (85% of estimated max ~265lbs)

Taper volume - focus on explosive bar speed and perfect form. Each rep should feel crisp and powerful. Feel your leg drive engage and maintain your arch throughout.

Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. Bar should move fast off your chest.

Scale: If bar speed slows, stop. You should feel strong and fresh.
workoutTemplates.notes: Film your sets. Focus on bar path - should be straight line from chest to lockout. Engage lats to create stable base. Drive through your feet to generate leg drive. Bar speed is the key indicator - if it slows, you're too heavy. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Bracchium
workoutTemplates.description:
Upper Body Accessory

3 Rounds:
8 Close-Grip Bench Press @ 155lbs
10 DB Rows each arm @ 50lb DB
12 Banded Face Pulls (moderate tension)

Light, controlled work. Focus on feeling the muscles work. Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

This maintains strength without adding fatigue during taper week.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep loads moderate. Focus on squeeze and contraction. Face pulls help with shoulder health - pull to your face, not your chest.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Levis
workoutTemplates.description:
10 Minute EMOM:
Minute 1: 12 Cal Assault Bike
Minute 2: 15 Push-Ups
Minute 3: 20 Air Squats
Minute 4: 10 KB Swings @ 53lbs
Minute 5: Rest

Repeat 2x through (10 minutes total)

Keep intensity moderate. Each minute should give you 15-20 seconds rest. This is about movement quality and maintaining conditioning, not maxing out.
workoutTemplates.notes: Pace yourself. If you're not getting 15+ seconds rest each minute, scale the reps down 20%.

workoutTemplates.name: Recuperatio
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery Day

20 Minutes:

5 minutes easy row or bike (conversational pace)

10 minutes mobility work:
- Shoulder circles and arm swings (2 min)
- Thoracic extensions on foam roller (3 min)
- Hip flexor stretches (2 min)
- Hamstring stretches (2 min)
- Cat-cow stretches (1 min)

5 minutes easy walk or light movement

This is full recovery mode. Keep everything easy and relaxed. Focus on breathing and feeling good.
workoutTemplates.notes: This is not a workout - it's recovery. Everything should feel easy and restorative. Spend extra time on areas that feel tight, especially shoulders and upper back given your mobility restrictions.

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Trahens Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
DEADLIFT MAX TEST

Warm-up Protocol:
Empty bar x 10
135lbs x 5
185lbs x 3
225lbs x 2
255lbs x 1
275lbs x 1

Then work up to max single:
Attempt 1: 295lbs
Attempt 2: 305lbs (if 295 moves well)
Attempt 3: 315lbs (if 305 moves well)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Stop if bar speed slows significantly or form breaks. Film all attempts.

This is your moment - let's see what you've got.
workoutTemplates.notes: FILM ALL HEAVY ATTEMPTS. Warm-up should feel easy and smooth - don't rush it. Rest 4-5 minutes between max attempts. Key form checkpoints: chest stays up throughout pull, hips and chest rise together, bar stays close to body, full lockout at top. If bar speed slows dramatically or your hips shoot up early, stop - that's your max for today. Safety first - we're testing current capacity, not risking injury. Use your judgment on attempt selection - if 295 feels heavy, don't jump to 315.

workoutTemplates.name: Genuflexio Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
BACK SQUAT MAX TEST

Warm-up Protocol:
Empty bar x 10
135lbs x 5
185lbs x 3
205lbs x 2
225lbs x 1
245lbs x 1

Then work up to max single:
Attempt 1: 265lbs
Attempt 2: 275lbs (if 265 moves well)
Attempt 3: 285lbs (if 275 moves well)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Focus on hitting consistent depth every rep. Stop if form breaks or bar speed slows. Film all attempts.

Time to establish your new squat baseline.
workoutTemplates.notes: FILM ALL HEAVY ATTEMPTS. I need to see depth consistency. Warm-up should be smooth and controlled. Rest 4-5 minutes between max attempts. Key form checkpoints: consistent depth (hip crease below knee), chest stays up, knees track over toes, maintain tension in the hole, drive through mid-foot. If depth gets shallow or you lose tightness in the bottom, that's your max. We're building a baseline, not chasing numbers that compromise form. Be honest with yourself on attempt selection.

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
BENCH PRESS MAX TEST

Warm-up Protocol:
Empty bar x 10
135lbs x 5
185lbs x 3
205lbs x 2
225lbs x 1
245lbs x 1

Then work up to max single:
Attempt 1: 265lbs
Attempt 2: 275lbs (if 265 moves well)
Attempt 3: 285lbs (if 275 moves well)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Focus on bar path and leg drive. Stop if bar speed slows or you lose tightness. Film all attempts.

This is your strength - let's see how far you've come.
workoutTemplates.notes: FILM ALL HEAVY ATTEMPTS. Warm-up should feel smooth and explosive. Rest 4-5 minutes between max attempts. Key form checkpoints: tight setup with feet driven into floor, maintain arch throughout, bar path straight from chest to lockout, engage lats for stable base, explosive drive off chest. If bar stalls midway or you lose leg drive, that's your max. Bench is your strength - trust your training and execute with confidence.

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Potentia Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
PUSH PRESS MAX TEST

Warm-up Protocol:
Empty bar x 10
95lbs x 5
115lbs x 3
135lbs x 2
155lbs x 1

Then work up to max single:
Attempt 1: 175lbs
Attempt 2: 185lbs (if 175 moves well)
Attempt 3: 195lbs (if 185 moves well)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Focus on explosive leg drive and timing. Respect your shoulder mobility limitations - don't force overhead position. Film all attempts.

Let's establish your push press baseline.
workoutTemplates.notes: FILM ALL HEAVY ATTEMPTS. Warm-up should feel smooth with good leg drive timing. Rest 4-5 minutes between max attempts. Key form checkpoints: explosive leg drive from quarter squat, aggressive hip extension, press bar overhead as hips extend, finish with bar over mid-foot. CRITICAL: Respect your shoulder mobility limitations - if you can't achieve stable overhead position, stop. Don't force range of motion. If bar drifts forward or you feel shoulder discomfort, that's your max. This lift depends on timing and power, not grinding.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Longus
workoutTemplates.description:
25 Minute Conditioning Session

Option A - CrossFit Style:
5 Rounds For Time:
400m Run
15 KB Swings @ 53lbs
12 Pull-Ups (or Ring Rows)

Option B - Steady State:
25 minutes easy pace on Assault Bike or Rower
Keep intensity at RPE 5-6, fully conversational

Pick the option that sounds better to you today. This is about maintaining conditioning capacity while allowing continued recovery from max testing week.

If you're still sore from testing, go with Option B.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep intensity moderate. If you did Option A and you're still breathing hard 2 minutes after finishing, you went too hard. If you did Option B, you should be able to hold a conversation throughout. This is active recovery disguised as conditioning.
